data.title: ABC Super Soap Weekend Disney’s Hollywood Studios Archives
data.meta_description: Super Soap Weekend at Disney's Hollywood Studios at Walt Disney World in Orlando Florida
data.text:
NOTE: The 2008 Super Soap Weekend at Disney's Hollywood Studios marked the last time this event will be held in Orlando. ABC's Daytime Division will instead send its soap opera stars on a 2009 Soap Nation Tour, a collection of nationwide events designed to interact with fans on a year-round basis offering greater access to stars in more cities, more often. The final Walt Disney World weekend was dedicated to the fans with special retrospectives and exclusive productions. For the full release, click HERE.

Click HERE for 2008 Photos!

Click HERE for 2007 Photos!

Click HERE for 2006 Photos and Reports!

INTRODUCTION

One weekend each fall, stars from the ABC soap operas make appearances at the Disney's Hollywood Studios. Park Guests are treated to a spectacular interactive weekend with their favorite actors and actresses from the ABC Daytime dramas All My Children, One Life to Live, and General Hospital.

SUPER SOAP WEEKEND

2008 DETAILS

Actress Susan Lucci headlined a star-studded lineup of more than 30 actors and actresses from the ABC Daytime dramas November 15-16, 2008, at the 13th annual ABC Super Soap Weekend at Disney's Hollywood Studios. Sherri Shepherd, co-host of The View, was on hand for the weekend. The actors held regular autograph sessions at stations throughout the park. Many of the stations are along New York Street and around Echo Lake.

Actors for the 2008 event were:

ABC Super Soap Weekend was the largest soap fan event held anywhere in the country. Festivities included autograph sessions, motorcades, interviews and talk shows, game shows, musical performances, and the chance to purchase one-of-a-kind memorabilia from the shows. The Colgate Total Street Jam will close the event each day with live musical performances by some favorite Daytime stars.

TOURING TIPS

Crowds for this event are huge — arrive early to see your favorite celebrities.

There is no additional ticket necessary for the Super Soap Weekend events — admission is included in regular theme park admission.

Try to obtain a schedule of events before you visit the theme park, so that you can plan your day. Autograph sessions, talk shows and other activities are staggered throughout the day, and the stars rotate through the different events.

Disney's FastPass, used in the theme parks to reduce wait times for attractions, has been used the last few years for "On Location" Autograph Sessions. It will work like this:

FastPass for Super Soap Weekend will work much as regular FastPass works. Visit our FastPass page for details. Note that a FastPass ticket will be required for each autograph. There is no limit to the number of FastPass Tickets a person can get, but there is a capacity limit for each autograph session. However, once all the FastPass tickets are distributed for a particular actor, a limited number of Standby Tickets will be made available. Standby Tickets do not guarantee an autograph, though — standby ticket holders will be taken if there is time remaining in a session after all FastPass ticket holders have received their autographs.

–ALL MY CHILDREN tickets will be distributed at Lights Motor Action Extreme Stunt Show.

–ONE LIFE TO LIVE tickets will be distributed at Star Tours.

–GENERAL HOSPITAL tickets will be distributed at Indiana Jones Epic Stunt Spectacular.

Tickets will be distributed on a first come, first serve basis. FastPasses will begin to be distributed when the park opens and are only good for Autograph Sessions that same day.

For the latest event updates, or more information about the ABC Super Soap Weekend Vacation package, check back to this site, call the Super Soap Hotline at (407) 397-6808 or visit the ABC-TV web site.

Assistive Listening Devices from Guest Services Can Be Used at some of the Super Soap Weekend events.

Reflective Captioning available at some Super Soap Weekend events.

Wheelchair/ECV Users can take advantage of a special viewing area at the main (Sorcerer's Hat) stage. No standing is allowed in this area — all party members must remain seated in the chairs located in this area. Due to capacity, party sizes are limited in this area to three guests. (The guest traveling in a wheelchair, plus two members of their party.)

KIDS AND CHARACTERS

Super Soap Weekend doesn't usually interfere with the scheduled character meet and greet opportunities at the Disney's Hollywood Studios, but some locations may be closed due to Super Soap events. Check your daily Times Guide for details.

INTERESTING FACTS/ARCHIVE INFO

2007 events:

SOAP CENTRAL

Be sure to check out Soap Central at the ABC Commissar — the popular gathering place for all ABC soap fans! Don't miss your chance to purchase show costumes, props, and other "one of a kind" items direct from the sets of your favorite ABC soaps.

"ON LOCATION" AUTOGRAPHS

Get "up close and personal" with your favorite ABC soap stars at special locations throughout the park.

SUPER SOAP TALK SHOW (off Sunset Boulevard)

Get the "Total" scoop at the Super Soap Theater for talk shows featuring the ABC Daytime soap stars LIVE on stage throughout the day! Enjoy an exclusive look at show clips and sneak previews of upcoming episodes and find out more about your favorite actors. Ask the stars what you've always wanted to know! Hosted by Bob Guiney.

SOAPNET'S "I WANNA BE A SOAP STAR"

Join in the fun of SOAPnet's I Wanna Be A Soap Star, where selected contestants will compete for their showbiz break to perform in an on-stage scene with one of ABC's hottest hunks. Hosted by Cameron Mathison. To add to the fun this year, make sure you log on to soapnet.com after the weekend is over to vote for your favorite finalist, and you could have a chance to win a trip for two to the 2008 Super Soap Weekend Event at Walt Disney World. (Contest rules available on soapnet.com.)

CELEBRITY MOTORCADES AND STAR CONVERSATIONS

See all the daytime glamour of the ABC soap stars in "Hollywood style" celebrity motorcades all day long. Each motorcade travels up Hollywood Boulevard to the Sorcerer's Hat stage and is followed by a conversation with the stars on stage.

COLGATE-TOTAL TRIPLE PLAY GAME SHOW

Join the fun as an actor from each of your favorite soaps teams up with two of their fans selected from the audience to play a fast paced, three-round game show. Who will come out on top, ALL MY CHILDREN, ONE LIFE TO LIVE or GENERAL HOSPITAL? You help decide as the entire audience plays along. Hosted by John-Paul Lavoisier and presented in the Theater of the Stars.

COLGATE® TOTAL® STREET JAM

Party each evening following the Grand Motorcade at the Colgate® Total® Street Jam – an incredible star-filled concert! Hosted this year by The View's Sherri Shepherd on Saturday night and by General Hospital's Kelly Monaco and Bob Guiney on Sunday night. ABC's talented performers will include Bobbie Eakes, Kathy Brier, Kassie DePaiva, Kristen Anderson, Tika Sumpter, Sonya Eddy, Melissa Claire Egan and Brandon Buddy.

Entertainment subject to change without notice. Event included with regular Disney's Hollywood Studios admission.

ABC Super Soap Weekend is included with theme park admission to the Disney's Hollywood Studios. For future updates and more information about ABC Super Soap Weekend, call the Super Soap Hotline at 407-397-6808 or visit http://abc.go.com.
